results.name: Lexicographically earliest permutation of positive integers starting with 2 such that a(a(n)+a(n+1)) is odd for all n.
comment: This is the sequence U defined in the comments on A255003.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: N:= 100: # to get a(n) for n <= N
for n from 2 to N do
if member(n,needodd) or maxodd < maxeven then
mathematica: Array[a, nn] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 04 2018, after _Robert Israel_ *)
program: | member x s || u < v = u : f xs u us vs' (insert (y + u) s)
| otherwise           = v : f xs v us' vs (insert (y + v) s)
